title: RDP window not expandable
author: nleboeuf
body_snippet:
Hi,
i have 2 screens, and i want to drap & drop my RDP tab from screen 1 to screen 2
I got this on screen 2.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39763048/40713368-0b74a136-6400-11e8-9403-b3d7b4a98a18.png)

## Expected Behavior
I'd like to new window be a classic Windows window. Not just a window with only the close button

## Current Behavior
It creates a non-expandable window, unusable.

## Possible Solution
Create a classic window, or find the good parameter in optio...

iterations.description: The RDP ActiveX control is explicitly set to Anchor=None during initialization, overriding Dock=Fill and preventing the session window from resizing with the application. Removing this line will restore proper docking behavior.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The RDP ActiveX control is explicitly set to Anchor=None during initialization, overriding Dock=Fill and preventing the session window from resizing with the application. Removing this line will restore proper docking behavior.
Approach: Remove 'Control.Anchor = AnchorStyles.None;' in RdpProtocol.cs (in both InitializeActiveXControl and InitializeActiveXControlAsync) to allow the control to respect 'Dock = DockStyle.Fill' set by the base class.
